@fodaveg sorry I didnâ€™t state it clearly. I want to record my daily life at different devices. I have an iPad, an android phone and a windows laptop, so I need use them at different situations. But the syncing is a problem.

I recently found I can use iOS shortcuts to boost and simplify the recording process, and I can combine working copy to achieve the pull and push operation. So I wan to change my phone to iOS.

Another reason, due to a series of processes, opening, writing, syncing, it will produce some psychological burden. Itâ€™s not worth to use it only for making some personal fragmented messages.

Since using #Mastodon, I haven't felt as eager to switch to an iPhone. It basically meets my needs for recording my daily life and random thoughts. I don't have to worry about syncing across different devices.

Therefore, #obsidian can also be used specifically to produce content of slightly higher quality.

Before I knew it, the #cactus I brought from the Bad Land had already begun to sprout new buds.

Life grows silently and gradually.

Slowly accumulating, slowly moving forward.

When it rains, it pours.

The sound really annoyed me. What made it even worse was that it made me spill water and trash.

Everything is a #mess, I'm so sleepy.

The repairmen have arrived; hopefully they can save me.

One more thing: the soaked beans also went bad. I tried washing them and boiling them, but the whole room smelled terrible.

I just went to the property management office to report the noise problem in the apartment office.
